definition: to leak (of information, liquid etc)/to divulge
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to leak/to divulge/to leave out by mistake/waterclock or hourglass (old)
to divulge secrets

sentences.english: He was worried about what might happen if they leaked out information.
sentences.chinese: 他擔心萬一他們走漏了風聲會出什麼事。

sentences.english: The news slowly filtered through to everyone in the office.
sentences.chinese: 這消息慢慢走漏出去，結果辦公室的人全知道了。

sentences.english: And I believe that it's leaking like a sieve.
sentences.chinese: 而且，我相信消息走漏得很快，就像過篩子一樣。

sentences.english: Bates was furious and demanded to know who had leaked the information.
sentences.chinese: 貝茨很憤怒，要查出來是誰走漏的消息。

sentences.english: We had to be very careful lest the the news should become known early.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須謹慎小心，兔得消息過早地走漏出去。

sentences.english: She never breathed a word of this .
We should try to prevent leakage of information.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該設法防止走漏風聲。

sentences.english: And not one of us must say a word about what we have found.
sentences.chinese: 關於我們的發現，我們中任何人都不能走漏一點風聲。

sentences.english: Someone has let the news out.
Those disclosures have come from leaked records obtained by the Daily Telegraph newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 這些走漏的消息都是來自《每日電報》。

definition: to divulge secrets
to leak secrets
to leak (information)/to divulge/also pr. [xie4 lou4]
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
a spy/a crafty person
to make inquiries/to try to find out/to pry
(of a liquid or gas) to leak/to divulge (a secret)/to leak
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
secret agent/detective
lit. to guard one's mouth like a closed bottle (idiom); tight-lipped/reticent/not breathing a word
to report secretly/to tip off
to monitor secretly/to spy on
eyes and ears/sb's attention or notice/information/knowledge/spies
undiscovered traitor/enemy within one's own ranks
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
handle/(fig.) information that can be used against sb
